data.title: Help Sublime Text users migrate to VS Code
data.body:
# Help Sublime Text 3 users migrate to VS Code

We want to provide more welcoming experience for Sublime Text 3 users when they try/open VS Code. In order to do that we want people to help migrate the followings:
- Basic global settings
- Basic user settings
- Basic project settings
- Snippets
- Keyboard shortcuts

**Future**
Provide recommendations for:
- Themes
- Extensions

## Structure of Sublime Text Settings
Sublime settings are stored as JSON files, in the following locations

- Packages/Default/Preferences.sublime-settings
- Packages/Default/Preferences (<platform>).sublime-settings
- Packages/User/Preferences.sublime-settings
- Project Settings
- Packages/<syntax>/<syntax>.sublime-settings
- Packages/User/<syntax>.sublime-settings
- Buffer Specific Settings

### Locations
OSX: ~/Library/Application Support/Sublime Text 3/Packages/
Windows: C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Sublime Text 2\Packages
Ubuntu: ~/.config/sublime-text-3/Packages/

### Mappable Sublime Text settings

**Sublime setting**|**Code setting**
:-----:|:-----:
theme|workbench.colorTheme
scroll_speed|editor.mouseWheelScrollSensitivity
hot_exit|files.hotExit
remember_open_files|window.restoreWindows
open_files_in_new_window|window.openFilesInNewWindow
close_windows_when_empty|window.closeWhenEmpty
show_full_path|"window.title": "${activeEditorFull}${separator}${rootName}",
preview_on_click|workbench.editor.enablePreview
folder_exclude_patterns|files.exclude
file_exclude_patterns|files.exclude
show_tab_close_buttons|workbench.editor.tabCloseButton (off)
save_on_focus_lost|files.autoSave (onFocusChange)
find_selected_text|editor.find.seedSearchStringFromSelection
word_separators|editor.wordSeparators
ensure_newline_at_eof_on_save|files.insertFinalNewline
auto_indent|editor.autoIndent
tab_size|editor.tabSize
use_tab_stops|editor.useTabStops
trim_automatic_white_space|editor.trimAutoWhitespace
detect_indentation|editor.detectIndentation
draw_white_space|editor.renderWhitespace
trim_trailing_white_space_on_save|files.trimTrailingWhitespace
tab_completion|editor.tabCompletion
auto_complete|editor.quickSuggestions
auto_complete_delay|editor.quickSuggestionsDelay
auto_complete_commit_on_tab|True => editor.acceptSuggestionOnEnter = "off"
copy_with_empty_selection|editor.emptySelectionClipboard
find_selected_text|autoFindInSelection
auto_find_in_selection|editor.find.autoFindInSelection
drag_text|editor.dragAndDrop
default_encoding|files.encoding
color_scheme|workbench.colorTheme
font_face|editor.fontFamily
font_size|editor.fontSize
line_numbers|editor.lineNumbers
fade_fold_buttons|"editor.showFoldingControls": "mouseover",
rulers|editor.rulers
caret_style|editor.cursorBlinking
scroll_past_end|editor.scrollBeyondLastLine
word_wrap|editor.wordWrap
wrap_width|editor.wordWrapColumn
indent_subsequent_lines|editor.wrappingIndent='none'
match_brackets|editor.matchBrackets
match_selection|editor.selectionHighlight
draw_indent_guides|editor.renderIndentGuides
remember_full_screen|window.restoreFullscreen

### Non-mapabble settings
**Sublime setting**|**Code setting**
:-----:|:-----:
mouse\_wheel\_switches\_tabs| 
ignored\_packages| 
binary\_file\_patterns| 
default\_dir| 
atomic\_save| 
auto\_match\_enabled| 
result\_file\_regex| 
result\_line\_regex| 
result\_base\_dir| 
build\_env| 
smart\_indent| 
indent\_to\_bracket| 
translate\_tabs\_to\_spaces| 
auto\_complete\_size\_limit| 
auto\_complete\_selector| 
auto\_complete\_triggers| 
auto\_complete\_with\_fields| 
auto\_complete\_cycle| 
auto\_close\_tags| 
shift\_tab\_unindent| 
command\_mode| 
move\_to\_limit\_on\_up\_down| 
is\_widget| 
spell\_check| 

More detailed comparison and mapping can be found in this spreadsheet: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1cpUGALUmd-_MPV3-fJfUTjQdCFTFm6RHTEfvMXNY8lw/edit?usp=sharing

## Snippets
We can detect if the user has any Sublime snippets, parse them and convert them to our snippet format. 

More about the snippet format can be read here, http://sublimetext.info/docs/en/extensibility/snippets.html

Prior art: 
- https://github.com/idleberg/sublime-atomizr
- https://github.com/james2doyle/sublime-to-atom-snippets

## Experience

### MVP as VS Code extension
New "Sublime migrator" extensions add a new command `Migrate from Sublime`, which when executed shows prompts for:
1. Do you want to import your Sublime user settings?
2. Do you want to import your Sublime project settings?
3. Do you want to import your Sublime snippets?

Migration runs in the background and shows a infoMessage when finished.

This command could be linked up on the welcome screen, as the existing key bindings for Sublime.

## Milestones
- [x] Enable migration of user settings
- [x] Enable migration of base+user settings 
- [x] Enable migration of base+user+project settings 
- [ ] Enable migration of user snippets

/Kenneth

data.title: Scrollbar highlighting of matches doesn't take word wrapping into account
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:07:25.676Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
spellright|ban|1.1.16
python|don|0.7.0
cpptools|ms-|0.12.3
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
blank-line-organizer|rin|0.1.2
sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0
change-case|wma|1.0.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable word wrapping.
2. Place the cursor inside a word that occurs in various places in the text file.
3. Notice how the highlighting of matches in the scrollbar doesn't match up with where the actual matching words are located.

Here is a screenshot to demonstrate the issue. The cursor is inside the word 'bar' on the 9th line. Notice that the highlighting in the scrollbar thinks line 9 is located 2 lines above where it actually is, and also notice that the highlighting in the scrollbar thinks the match on line 5 is located 1 line above where it actually is. Clearly, this must be because the scrollbar is not accounting for the word wrapped lines in this document.
![scrollbar_wordwrap](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3789849/29525325-2d0492c4-868a-11e7-9f69-025d56c25507.png)




<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

3. Press <kbd>Shift+F5</kbd>

data.title: Stop Visual Studio code cursor from moving to end of line when taking a small pause while editing some text
data.body:
Hi 
My Visual Studio code cursor from moving to end of line when taking a small  pause while editing some text inside my file.
Every time i am writing something and as i stop writing something for some fraction of seconds the cursor automatically goes to the end of the line and thus making it very difficult to write anything.

Please help asap.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:16:27.618Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-92-generic
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
output-colorizer|IBM|0.1.2
latex-preview|ajs|0.5.1
code-gnu-global|aus|0.2.2
vscode-node-readme|ben|1.1.0
npm-intellisense|chr|1.3.0
vscode-npm-source|dku|1.0.0
githistory|don|0.2.3
python|don|0.7.0
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0
vscode-npm|fkn|3.3.0
MagicPython|mag|1.0.12
vscode-clang|mit|0.2.2
cpptools|ms-|0.12.3
unicode-latex|oij|1.0.2
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
RustyCode|sav|0.19.1
cmake|twx|0.0.17
cmake-tools|vec|0.10.2

(2 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code
2. Create new folder
3. Create new file
4. Write some code:
```
#include <iostream>

int main() {
  int a = 11;
  int b = 22;
  int c = a + b;
  std::cout << c;
  return 0;
}
```
5. Save it as e.g. debug_test.cpp
6. Compile it `g++ debug_test.cpp -Wall -g`
7. Add breakpoint at e.g. add operation 
8. Create configuration file:
```
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "name": "(gdb) Launch",
      "type": "cppdbg",
      "request": "launch",
      "program": "enter program name, for example ${workspaceRoot}/a.out",
      "args": [],
      "stopAtEntry": false,
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
      "environment": [],
      "externalConsole": true,
      "MIMode": "gdb",
      "setupCommands": [
          {
              "description": "Enable pretty-printing for gdb",
              "text": "-enable-pretty-printing",
              "ignoreFailures": true
          }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

9.Run debugger
10. Error appears.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: Constant jumping due to Code lens updating
CTRL+P not finding node.js module files?
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. add a node.js project folder i.e. https://github.com/Azure-Samples/raspberry-pi-web-simulator
2. install a new module to node js project. In my case, I installed "npm install file-system"
3.  verify it by navigating to "raspberry-pi-web-simulator-source\node_modules\file-system\file-system.js" in VS Explorer.
4. Search for file-system.js using CTRL+P.
Current result: No file found
Expected result: file-system.js

I guess VS only search for recently open files, not all project files but not sure of the intention.

- VSCode Version: 1.15.1

- OS Version: Windows 10

data.title: ctrl+shift+b - running default build task does not work when focused on TS script
data.body:
With VSC 1.15.1 (64 bit) triggering default build task does not work when I'm focused (open) TS file.
When focused on other type of files (HTML / JSON etc) - works fine.

When focused on TS file it opens list of tsc build tasks based on tsconfig file instead.

data.title: Hard-coded debug hover regexp is not suitable for OCaml language

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:07:25.676Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
---
Current debug hover implementation uses hard-coded regexp to extract evaluated expression: (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/debugHover.ts#L139)

```
// If there are non-word characters after the cursor, we want to truncate the expression then.
// For example in expression 'a.b.c.d', if the focus was under 'b', 'a.b' would be evaluated.
if (matchingExpression) {
	let subExpression: RegExp = /\w+/g;
```

For most programming languages this works ok, but not for OCaml whose identifiers can contain apostrophes: 
```
lowercase-ident ::= | (az_){letter09_'}
letter ::= | AZaz
```

So when I debug an OCaml program using [vscode-ocaml extension](https://github.com/hackwaly/vscode-ocaml) and hover over `a'` variable, VS code tries to evaluate `a` instead (see https://github.com/hackwaly/vscode-ocaml/issues/110)

Can this regexp be made configurable so that an extension could change it if necessary?

data.title: Output view always moves to front
data.body:
- install the Java Extension
- enable `"java.trace.server": "verbose"` is settings
- open a folder with Java with some errors
- try to look at the errors in the problems view
- the output view gets in the focus again as some message was printed
-> this makes it almost impossible to use the problems view

data.title: nuxt debug by npm 1.15.1 connect ECONNREFUSED
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:1.15.1
- OS Version: 10.12.4
- Node Version:8.3.0
i learned debug nuxt from the article.But it don't work in 1.15.1 & node 8.3
[debugging-nuxt-js-with-visual-studio-code](https://medium.com/@marshallswain/debugging-nuxt-js-with-visual-studio-code-724920140b8f)
```
package.json
"dev-debug": "node --debug node_modules/.bin/nuxt",

launch.json
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "npm run dev",
      "runtimeExecutable": "npm",
      "windows": {
        "runtimeExecutable": "npm.cmd"
      },
      "runtimeArgs": [
        "run",
        "dev-debug"
      ],
      "port": 5858
    },
    {
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "Launch Program",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/start"
    },
    {
      "type": "node",
      "request": "attach",
      "name": "Attach to Port",
      "address": "localhost",
      "port": 5858
    }
  ]
}
```
i change '--debug' to '-- inspect' or 
```
"protocol": "debug"
to
"protocol":"inspector"
```
i have try use 'legacy' but still wrong
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9362926/29505502-58a6cdd6-8679-11e7-9377-b1103ffb9ea6.png)

[vscode-debug-offical-documents](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/nodejs/nodejs-debugging)

data.title: The width of hard tab different by css property.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:15:57.756Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4 beautify|Hoo|1.1.1 code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.3 html-snippets|abu|0.1.0 vscode-caniuse|aka|0.5.3 Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2 project-manager|ale|0.19.0 vscode-svgviewer|css|1.4.2 vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11 githistory|don|0.2.3 jquerysnippets|don|0.0.1 python|don|0.7.0 php-debug|fel|1.11.1 php-intellisense|fel|1.5.0 auto-close-tag|for|0.4.3 rest-client|hum|0.15.1 docthis|joe|0.4.8 vscode-insertdatestring|jsy|2.1.0 MagicPython|mag|1.0.12 prettify-json|moh|0.0.3 easy-less|mrc|1.4.5 vscode-csscomb|mrm|5.1.0 mssql|ms-|1.1.0 debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.8 vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0 partial-diff|ryu|0.3.1 Align|ste|0.2.0 highlight-matching-tag|vin|0.4.4 change-case|wma|1.0.0 JavaScriptSnippets|xab|1.4.1 (5 theme extensions excluded) --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open new file. (Command + n) 1. Paste the sample code below. 1. Change the file type to css. 1. Set the settings of indentations. 1. Indent Using Tabs. 1. Tab size any. (I'm using 4) **Sample Code** ```css .button { display: inline-block; font-size: .7rem; padding: 3px 6px 1px; text-decoration: none; border-radius: 6px; cursor: pointer; box-shadow: 0 1px 0 0 #fff6af; background: linear-gradient(to bottom, #ffec64 5%, #ffab23 100%); background-color: #ffec64; border: 1px solid #ffaa22; color: #333; text-shadow: 0 1px 0 #ffee66; } ``` You'll see that the tab size of under the box-shadow is abnormal. ## Normal ![nomal-tab-width](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13681880/29505140-42d441f4-867f-11e7-85aa-81cf597dcb06.png)
## Abnormal ![abnomal-tab-width](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13681880/29505142-4d914d76-867f-11e7-8f29-84194cad3dee.png) The element.style seems to be removed by some processing. I confirmed this problem on css, less and sass. And I confirmed this problem on Windows 7 Home 64bit, latest vs code. Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Integrate inline color boxes & API finalization.
data.body:
Fix #32295. Move inline color boxes rendering to core/contrib as we already ask for color ranges.

This adds a new option `renderDecorator` to color range, which decides whether we should render inline box for a color range. cc @jrieken @joaomoreno

data.title: Dragging on tab bar with side-by-side split can select text in an unusual way
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:07:25.676Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
jslint|ajh|1.2.1
spellcheck|Jul|1.1.4
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
vim|vsc|0.9.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a vertical split with two documents open side-by-side
2. Move the cursor to the right of the area in the tab bar where the splits can be dragged to rearrange. While over the area used for rearranging splits, the cursor will change to a hand, and when over the buttons to the right the cursor will change to a pointer. However, there is a 2 pixel wide space in-between where the cursor will be a standard pointer.
3. Click and drag from this point across to the left sidebar or the status bar.
4. Text in the editor will become highlighted but in a bright blue colour different to the normal selection colour. If the find results window is open, text in that will be included in the selection.
5. Copy with the current selection. If the text in the left pane was highlighted, the titles of the tabs on the right pane will also be copied to the clipboard, and the "no results" or "x of x" text in the find results window will also be copied to the clipboard.  

Was not expecting to be able to select text from clicking outside the editor window and text was highlighted with a colour inconsistent with the selected theme. Although not visibly highlighted, text that formed part of the UI as opposed to the current buffer was selected and could be copied.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

edit: added screenshot to better illustrate what happens. Annotations in red
![vscode](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8509978/29503730-be8c0cac-867d-11e7-9b49-252f1926de00.png)

data.title: Feature Request: Have the Code 64-bit installer migrate settings/extensions from 32-bit installation
data.body: I was excited when I heard about the new 64-bit edition of Code for Windows, but when I opened the installer it said I had to manually uninstall the 32-bit version first. I already have a couple of extensions installed, so I'm hesitant to install them all again on the new edition. It would be great if the 64-bit installer automatically trasnsferred all of your extensions/settings from the 32-bit Code (and handled the uninstallation for you, too).
